meanings.definition: Make appropriate return for (a favor, service, or wrongdoing).
meanings.sent1: I will requite your kindness by helping you with your project.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to requite any favors done for her.
meanings.sent3: He decided to requite the favor by baking cookies for his neighbor.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to requite every act of kindness was truly admirable.
meanings.sent5: The best way to requite a good deed is by paying it forward.

meanings.sent1: The hero sought to requite the villain's evil deeds.
meanings.sent2: In the end, justice will requite all wrongs.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to requite the dog's theft of its toy by hiding the dog's bone.
meanings.sent4: The avenger's mission was to requite the loss of innocent lives.
meanings.sent5: The warrior vowed to requite the betrayal with swift retribution.
